blocks.name: OPTIONS
blocks.description: Options controlling lake package behavior and output.

variables.name: AUXILIARY
variables.description: Defines auxiliary variable names to be associated with each lake.
variables.tooltip: One or more names of auxiliary variables read with each lake entry. Can be used for transport concentrations or user-defined data.

variables.name: BOUNDNAMES
variables.description: Keyword to activate reading of boundary names for each lake.
variables.tooltip: When specified, each lake entry can include an optional text name for grouping in budget reporting and observations.

variables.name: PRINT_INPUT
variables.description: Keyword to print lake input data to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, lake data read for each stress period is echoed to the listing file.

variables.name: PRINT_STAGE
variables.description: Keyword to print lake stage to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, the computed lake stage is printed to the listing file for each time step.

variables.name: PRINT_FLOWS
variables.description: Keyword to print lake flow rates to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, computed lake flow rates are printed to the listing file for each time step.

variables.name: SAVE_FLOWS
variables.description: Keyword to save lake flow terms to the cell-by-cell budget file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, lake-aquifer flow exchange terms are written to the binary budget file.

variables.name: STAGE FILEOUT
variables.description: Name of the binary file for writing lake stage output.
variables.tooltip: Specifies the file name for saving computed lake stages over time.

variables.name: BUDGET FILEOUT
variables.description: Name of the binary file for writing detailed lake budget output.
variables.tooltip: Specifies the file name for saving the detailed lake budget including all inflows and outflows.

variables.name: SURFDEP
variables.description: Depth of the surface depression that must be filled before lake outflow occurs.
variables.tooltip: The depth of surface depressions around the lake that must fill before surface outflow can begin. Used to prevent unrealistic rapid lake stage changes. Default is 0.0.

blocks.name: PACKAGEDATA
blocks.description: Static lake data defining the physical properties of each lake.

variables.name: LAKENO
variables.description: Lake number (sequential, one-based identifier).
variables.tooltip: Unique identifier for each lake, numbered from 1 to the total number of lakes.

variables.name: STRT
variables.description: Starting stage (water surface elevation) of the lake.
variables.tooltip: Initial lake stage at the beginning of the simulation. For steady-state simulations, serves as the initial guess.

variables.name: NLAKECONN
variables.description: Number of GWF cells connected to this lake.
variables.tooltip: The number of aquifer cells that exchange water with this lake. Must match the number of CONNECTIONDATA entries for this lake.

variables.name: AUX
variables.description: Values for each auxiliary variable defined in OPTIONS.
variables.tooltip: One value for each auxiliary variable in the order they were defined.

variables.name: BOUNDNAME
variables.description: Text name for the lake boundary (up to 40 characters).
variables.tooltip: Optional name for the lake, used in budget reporting and observations. Only read if BOUNDNAMES is specified in OPTIONS.

blocks.name: CONNECTIONDATA
blocks.description: Lake-aquifer connection data defining how each lake cell connects to the groundwater model.

variables.name: LAKENO
variables.description: Lake number for which connections are specified.
variables.tooltip: The lake number from PACKAGEDATA to which this connection applies.

variables.name: ICONN
variables.description: Connection number (sequential within each lake, one-based).
variables.tooltip: Sequential identifier for each lake-aquifer connection, numbered from 1 to NLAKECONN for this lake.

variables.name: CELLID
variables.description: Cell identifier for the connected GWF cell.
variables.tooltip: Identifies the aquifer cell connected to the lake at this interface.

variables.name: CLAKTYPE
variables.description: Type of lake-aquifer connection.
variables.tooltip: VERTICAL for connections through the lake bottom. HORIZONTAL for connections through the lake sides. EMBEDDEDH for horizontal embedded lakes. EMBEDDEDV for vertical embedded lakes.

variables.name: BEDLEAK
variables.description: Lakebed leakance (hydraulic conductivity divided by bed thickness), in units of 1/time.
variables.tooltip: Controls the resistance to flow through the lakebed. Higher values allow more flow. Set to 0 for no-flow lakebed. Use NONE for no lakebed resistance (direct aquifer contact).

variables.name: BELEV
variables.description: Bottom elevation of the lake-aquifer connection, in model length units.
variables.tooltip: The bottom elevation of this connection interface. For HORIZONTAL connections, this is the bottom of the connection face.

variables.name: TELEV
variables.description: Top elevation of the lake-aquifer connection, in model length units.
variables.tooltip: The top elevation of this connection interface. For HORIZONTAL connections, this is the top of the connection face.

variables.name: CONNLEN
variables.description: Distance between the lake and the connected cell center, in model length units.
variables.tooltip: The flow path length between the lake and the aquifer cell center. Used to compute the conductance of the connection.

variables.name: CONNWIDTH
variables.description: Width of the lake-aquifer connection perpendicular to flow, in model length units.
variables.tooltip: The cross-sectional width of the connection interface. Used with CONNLEN to compute the conductance.

blocks.name: PERIOD
blocks.description: Stress period data specifying time-varying lake settings and boundary conditions.

variables.name: LAKENO
variables.description: Lake number for which settings are specified.
variables.tooltip: The lake number from PACKAGEDATA to which the following setting applies.

variables.name: LAKSETTING
variables.description: Keyword and value pair specifying a time-varying property for the lake.
variables.tooltip: STATUS sets the lake state (ACTIVE, INACTIVE, CONSTANT). STAGE fixes the lake stage. RAINFALL adds direct precipitation (L/T). EVAPORATION removes water (L/T). RUNOFF adds overland flow (L3/T). INFLOW specifies tributary inflow (L3/T). WITHDRAWAL specifies water withdrawal (L3/T). RATE specifies an outlet flow rate.
